feed.title: dylan on
feed.subtitle: Personal site for Dylan On, arts admin, web designer, and theatre tweeter.

entry.content: Great chance to slow down and recharge this weekend with family. Lots of kicking back by the pool. Bring it, Monday.
entry.summary: Great chance to slow down and recharge this weekend with family. Lots of kicking back by the pool. Bring it, Monday.

entry.title: SpiderWebShow Thought Residency - #4
entry.content:
Hey, it’s Dylan again. Thought #4 is about sharing, artistic labour, and money.

I’ll be among the first to advocate for more openness, more sharing of artistic works, the ability to build upon them… I think that if art is a public good it should be freely available.

However, I have to wonder if sharing freely in this way undervalues - devalues artistic labour in an industry that already has problems being undervalued socially and with actual dollars.

This material was created by Dylan On and spiderwebshow.ca, and is licensed under CC BY-NC-ND 4.0.
entry.summary: Hey, it’s Dylan again. Thought #4 is about sharing, artistic labour, and money. I’ll be among the first to advocate for more openness, more sharing of artistic works, the ability to build upon them… I think that if art is a public good it should be freely available. However, I have to wonder if sharing freely in this way undervalues - devalues artistic labour in an industry that already has problems being undervalued socially and with actual dollars.

entry.title: SpiderWebShow Thought Residency - #3
entry.content:
Hey, it’s Dylan with Thought #3.

As scrappy as theatres can be, we use a lot of technology, and most of it is proprietary. Other people build it, and theatres pay to use it.

I’ve been dreaming of a world where theatres will have the money to hire technical people to be on staff to collectively build and maintain the tools we need as an industry, and make them freely available for anyone’s use. So, that’s the idea - Let’s do it! I don’t know where we find the money, but let’s open source theatre technology.

This material was created by Dylan On and spiderwebshow.ca, and is licensed under CC BY-NC-ND 4.0.
entry.summary: Hey, it’s Dylan with Thought #3. As scrappy as theatres can be, we use a lot of technology, and most of it is proprietary. Other people build it, and theatres pay to use it. I’ve been dreaming of a world where theatres will have the money to hire technical people to be on staff to collectively build and maintain the tools we need as an industry, and make them freely available for anyone’s use. So, that’s the idea - Let’s do it! I don’t know where we find the money, but let’s open source theatre technology.

entry.content: My 2nd thought for SpiderWebShow - I take a lot of inspiration from how developers organize their work. #cdncult

entry.content: Wowed by Bellwoods Brewery’s Cherry Jelly King - Deliciously sour. I’m always taken by how easy-drinking Bellwoods’ beers are, despite being pretty adventurous with flavours and ABV.
entry.summary: Wowed by Bellwoods Brewery’s Cherry Jelly King - Deliciously sour. I’m always taken by how easy-drinking Bellwoods’ beers are, despite being pretty adventurous with flavours and ABV.

entry.content: Imagining we’re still on that patio drinking some tasty brews… ☔
entry.summary: Imagining we’re still on that patio drinking some tasty brews… ☔

entry.content: Huge turnout last night for Potluck XIV at The Theatre Centre. So impressed see the resources fu-GEN consistently devotes to helping Asian Canadian creators develop new work. It’s important. And the value to the community is apparent. (Also the food is always unbelievable.)
entry.summary: Huge turnout last night for Potluck XIV at The Theatre Centre. So impressed see the resources fu-GEN consistently devotes to helping Asian Canadian creators develop new work. It’s important. And the value to the community is apparent. (Also the food is always unbelievable.)

entry.content: Okay, now my micro.blog profile is set up properly. Follow me here! (Tip for Jekyll users: set title: "" in your YAML front matter for microblog posts, or else Jekyll will automatically generate a title from the file name.)
entry.summary: Okay, now my micro.blog profile is set up properly. Follow me here! (Tip for Jekyll users: set title: "" in your YAML front matter for microblog posts, or else Jekyll will automatically generate a title from the file name.)

entry.content: Fantastic launch event for the Toronto Fringe’s new Fringe Club at Scadding Court Community Centre. Highlight was a Chinese song & dance performance by members of the Singing Social Club. So happy to see the Fringe forging strong ties with the community right from the start.
entry.summary: Fantastic launch event for the Toronto Fringe’s new Fringe Club at Scadding Court Community Centre. Highlight was a Chinese song & dance performance by members of the Singing Social Club. So happy to see the Fringe forging strong ties with the community right from the start.
